intro: Haplopappus rusbyi, commonly known as the Rusby's pappus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and desert regions. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and it produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Haplopappus rusbyi is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions with minimal water requirements.
